roleset.name: come about, arisen
roleset.note: DEVELOP-V NOTES: Updated by Julia (after much discussion) to address the weird 'location as subject' issue and inconsistancy in the annotation of theme. See Examples and VN.Member of Vncls appear-48.1.1, occurrence-48.3. (from develop.01-v)
DEVELOPMENT-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls occurrence-48.3, appear-48.1.1. (from development.01-n)
DEVELOPED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, develop-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls appear-48.1.1, occurrence-48.3. (from developed.01-j)

example.name: Intransitive / Inchoative-- new annotation of theme
example.text: A problem developed.

example.name: transitive, location as subject!
example.text: John's neck developed a big spot.

example.name: transitive, theme as subject!
example.text: A big spot developed on John's neck.

example.name: autogen1
example.text: the development of cancer and other problems in the daughters ofwomen who took the drug
example.arg: in the daughters of women who took the drug

example.name: because this develops on its own
example.text: the development of a vigorous private sector

example.name: with MNR
example.text: the European TV industry 's sluggish development .

example.name: both args
example.text: the tumor's development in salivary glands in rats.

example.name: both args in PPs
example.text: the development of tumors in animals after inoculation with tumor cells

example.name: both args, arg2 POSS
example.text: his development of a condition believed to be autism.
example.arg: of a condition believed to be autism

example.name: arg2
example.text: Because his consciousness is not very developed, the child can tolerate it, otherwise he would die.

roleset.name: create, having been intentionally grown, built up
roleset.note: DEVELOP-V NOTES: Member of VNcls build-26.1, grow-26.2. (from develop.02-v)
DEVELOPMENT-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls build-26.1, grow-26.2. (from development.02-n)
DEVELOPED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, develop-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls build-26.1, grow-26.2. (from developed.02-j)

roles.note: The following structures should be used in all cases, even when it feelslike the Arg1 and the purpose clause (secondary predicate) are veryclosely linked and feel like they should be a single argument.Treebank is inconsistent in it treatment of these; sometimes it'ssplit into two nodes, sometimes there's a single node holding both.If we are consistent in dividing these arguments, it's relatively easyfor someone else to merge them. The reverse is not true. (from develop.02-v) This frame differs from develop.02 in that arg4 is no longer "attribute/secondary predicatation" (the args that appeared to cover may be coverd by argms such as PRP, it turns out, and will probably not occur here in their own nodes anyway), but is now a final product, as final products separate from arg1 showed up in several examples. (from development.02-n)

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 being developed, if in addition to arg1

example.name: transitive
example.text: John developed a strong argument

example.name: transitive-1
example.text: UCLA developed a new promoter gene

example.name: but
example.text: John developed a new promoter gene at UCLA

example.name: with source
example.text: John developed a strong argument from the footnotes of the paper.
example.arg: from the footnotes of the paper

example.name: with end-result
example.text: John developed the footnotes into a strong argument.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: Bill Gates developed DOS for Microsoft

example.name: with secondary predication
example.text: Albert M. Kligman developed Retin-A [to combat acne]

example.name: with secondary predication
example.text: Albert M. Kligman developed Retin-A for combating acne.

example.name: Manner
example.text: John developed the beach through a trust

example.name: with arg-1
example.text: new - product development

example.name: intentional real-estate development
example.text: development of a well off Texas ' Matagorda Island where it found gas in 1987
example.arg: of a well off Texas ' Matagorda Island where it found gas in 1987

example.name: with LOC
example.text: foreign development ventures

example.name: with beneficiary, arg3
example.text: the development of a product for a customer

example.name: with args 1, 2 and 4
example.text: the development of a product from sketches or drawings to being a manufactured entity.

example.name: args 1 and 5
example.text: Other developments that contributed to the economic development of southwest Louisiana after 1880 were:

example.name: with CXN
example.text: China is decades from *PRO* being as developed as the US , regardless of the amount of money they have - China s greatest compromise is time .
